decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful spells such as Force of Will and Council's Judgment while generating card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Sylvan Library. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Spell Pierce and Force of Negation, while also utilizing removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck has a strong top end with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with efficient win conditions like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize graveyard recursion and sacrifice effects to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, reanimate them, and generate value through triggers from cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine. Hogaak serves as the primary win condition, supported by cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast combo strategy that can be difficult to interact with, especially in the Legacy format where it can take advantage of powerful mana acceleration and disruption.

The main goal of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Baleful Strix, Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, and removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to generate card advantage and control the game. With a mix of counter magic, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to out-value and out-last the opponent in a game of attrition.

The deck aims to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand by using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat them into play. It also includes card draw and counterspells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is optimized for fast acceleration while also providing the necessary colors for the spells. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game and control the board to secure a win.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Dark Confidant, Delver of Secrets, and Tarmogoyf. Utilizing cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Abrupt Decay for value, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game. The land base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to provide consistency and mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the high mana production from Gaea's Cradle and the synergy between various Elf creatures to quickly and efficiently generate a large amount of mana, draw through the deck with Glimpse of Nature, and ultimately assemble a lethal board state with a Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and explosive combo, utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to efficiently tutor for key pieces of the combo.

This control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and efficient removal spells to control the game and outvalue opponents. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with countermagic and removal while drawing cards and generating value with cards like Sylvan Library and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes strong control finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. Additionally, the deck is able to control the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Abrupt Decay while setting up powerful synergies with cards like Life from the Loam and Field of the Dead.

This deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to enable powerful effects from cards like Death's Shadow and Street Wraith. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to disrupt your opponent's game plan, combined with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Ethereal Forager, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game. The deck also includes a suite of counterspells to protect your threats and disrupt your opponent's spells, along with removal like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with opposing threats.

The main concept of this deck is to generate as much mana as possible in a single turn, using cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, in order to combo off and cast a spell like Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, and can use cards like Infernal Tutor and Wishclaw Talisman to search for key combo pieces. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through a storm mechanic, overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and control the game by aggressively applying pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counter spells and cards like Stifle. The deck aims to utilize efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf to deal damage while also utilizing powerful spells like Brainstorm and Force of Will to maintain tempo and protect its own threats. The mana base is designed to support both the aggressive strategy and the control elements of the deck.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Sprite Dragon, and Young Pyromancer, which can quickly put pressure on the opponent. It also includes powerful countermagic like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats. The deck aims to control the game with disruptive cards like Stifle and Wasteland while dealing direct damage with cards like Lightning Bolt. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently, securing a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents while establishing a fast and aggressive board presence. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate to slow down opponents, combined with efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with threats from creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Skyclave Apparition. Additionally, cards like Mother of Runes and Flickerwisp provide additional protection and versatility, allowing the deck to adapt to different situations. The deck's mana denial strategy with cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland further solidifies its aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing lands to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By having cards like Wasteland and Crop Rotation, the deck can disrupt the opponent's mana base and disrupt their key lands. The combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage is also a win condition, allowing the player to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. Additionally, cards like Sylvan Library and Green Sun's Zenith provide card advantage and flexibility in finding key cards. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through strategic land plays and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. It also includes cards like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to handle opposing threats. The inclusion of powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath allows the deck to generate card advantage and outvalue opponents. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Wasteland. Overall, the deck seeks to apply pressure early and control the game through disruption and card advantage.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board while utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Young Pyromancer. The deck also includes disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base consists of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana access. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on, backed up by counterspells and removal spells to maintain dominance throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to leverage the combo potential of Show and Tell to cheat out powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Venser, Shaper Savant to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's plays, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and win the game before the opponent can react. The deck also includes various card manipulation and permission spells to ensure consistency and protect the combo.
